description: From French détonation; equivalent to detonate +‎ -ion.

definitionGroups.group: (chemistry) An explosion or sudden report made by the near-instantaneous decomposition or combustion of unstable substances. Specifically, combustion that spreads supersonically via shock compression.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Any sudden explosion made by an exothermic process (whether chemical or not) that produces a supersonic shock wave.
(mechanical engineering) Engine knocking, a type of improper combustion in gasoline piston engines.
